intro: Anarthria polyphylla, commonly known as the African violet, is a flowering plant native to tropical Africa. It is characterized by its rosette-shaped leaves and showy, clustered flowers that come in a variety of colors. The plant belongs to the Gesneriaceae family and is often cultivated as a houseplant due to its ornamental value. It prefers bright, indirect light and well-draining soil to thrive. Its botanical features make it a popular choice for indoor gardening and botanical study.
